oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rigsby's feed and seed
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Clement, William L., photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: W.T. Ford, driver for Rigsby's Feed & Seed Company ready to distribute four hundred pounds per acre of 6-12-12 fertilizer and thirty pounds fescue per acre. Field will be used for recreation and is a TAP project in cooperation with Lion's Club, County and DeKalb telephone company. Seed and fertilizer donated by Rigsby's Feed & Seed and Farmer's Co-op. Seedbed preparation by county owned equipment.

One in a series of photographs of agricultural activities in Cannon County, TN that were taken by W.L. Clement, District Conservationist for the U.S. Soil Conservation Service, and his assistants between the mid-1940s and mid-1970s.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photographs of W.L. Clement, U.S. Soil Conservation Service
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fertilizer equipment;
Trucks;
